definition: see 赤嵌樓|赤嵌楼[Chi4 kan3 lou2]
to go forward/to advance/to go in/to enter/to put in/to submit/to take in/to admit/(math.) base of a number system/classifier for sections in a building or residential compound

sentences.english: Each settlement of the Pilgrims was a little piece of the Old World inserted into the New.
sentences.chinese: 每一处清教徒的居留地，都是嵌进新大陆的旧世界。

sentences.english: Draw a box around your answer.
sentences.chinese: 他把一张画嵌进框子里。

sentences.english: Moistened pasteboard or cloth was inserted between each disc.
sentences.chinese: 每块金属板中间嵌进湿纸板或布料。

sentences.english: The bullet bedded itself in the wall.
Mosasaur bones have also been found with shark teeth embedded in them.
sentences.chinese: 曾经在沧龙类的骨头上发现了锐利的牙齿嵌进骨头内。

sentences.english: They have tailed the timber in the wall.
sentences.chinese: 他们已经将木料的一端嵌进墙里。

sentences.english: A shell splinter embedded itself in the wall.
A piece of embedded software that has been designed specifically for use as a debugging tool.
sentences.chinese: 嵌进式软件被特殊设计来作为除错工具的一部分。

sentences.english: The timber will be tailed in the wall.
sentences.chinese: 木料的一端将被嵌进墙壁。

sentences.english: The cupboards are built into the walls.
The ceiling-mounted cassette type indoor unit is widely used in different type buildings.
sentences.chinese: 嵌进式空调室被广泛地应用于各种不同的场合。

sentences.english: He let a picture into the frame .
sentences.chinese: 他把一张画嵌进框子里。

sentences.english: He suffered much from the bullet embedded in the bone.
sentences.chinese: 嵌进骨中的子弹使他疼痛难忍。

definition: to detain/to hold back by force/to buckle/to hook
to insert/to stick in/to plug in (an electronic device)
to fasten tightly with a hoop
to be drenched with blood/dripping blood
to be badly mangled or mutilated (idiom)
to rupture/to burst open/to break up
